Tecmo Game names
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher DS Archive (DS): Japanese DS Games Archive: Monster Farm DS: Misc. Q&A (post all new topics here, we'll make more sections later): Tecmo Game names
By Thorr on Friday, September 28, 2007 - 06:14 am:

IGN DS recently published this -
"With the DS' in-built microphone, you can say hundreds of words to summon new creatures. Locations in Japan, the names of other Tecmo games (Dead or Alive, Ninja Gaiden and so on), greetings and more all have unique effects. What is more, the Tecmo rep at the booth said that there were plenty of hidden monsters in there that only the company knew about right now; players will really have to get creative to unlock them all."

So, I was wondering if the TECMO game names have already been tried? Speaking into my microphone is an issue, since I just started and can only play during my off-time at work.

Here is a link to GameFAQ's list of Tecmo games - http://www.gamefaqs.com/features/company/10644.html
They have the Japanese names available too. I figure this is a good place to start.

By Thorr on Friday, September 28, 2007 - 06:47 am:

I locked myself away in a bathroom and tried a few titles...

Solomon No Kagi - #13 (big doggie/Lesionne)
Monsuta Faa-m - #28 (caterpi/durahan)
Tecmo - #97 Mocchi/Mocchi
Star Force (Staa Foss) - #169 (seuzo/tiger)
Ninja Gaiden - #172 (seuzo/henger?)
Dead or Alive - Locked for me
Rygar - Locked for me
Tsuppari Oozumou - #59 (Falco/Dragon)

I tried to say these in a japanese fashion..

I'd be interested to see variations here.

By Thorr on Friday, September 28, 2007 - 06:58 am:

Ok, I got my combination names a bit wrong, but it's only because I don't know the icons yet.. A lot of these monster types are from MR games that haven't played. I played MR1 extensively, but never really got into MR2. I never got a PS2 (got married, had a family, could only get 1 game system and have stuck with Nintendo all along), although GoldenBoy offered to let me borrow his so that I could give MR3 and MR4 a whirl.

So, please forgive my temporary unfamiliarity with the main monster breeds. I hope to remedy that problem as I play the game.

By GM on Friday, September 28, 2007 - 09:02 am:

You'll have an easier time recognizing the breeds by comparing
the numbers to those in the regeneration list.

The monsters that you apparently haven't recognized are as
follows:

Big Doggie: Baku (MR2, MR3, MR4)

Caterpi: Piroro (MREvo)

Caterpi/Durahan: Gold Piroro (Piroro/?)

Suezo/Henger?: Zanzo (Suezo/Zan)

You'll get the hang of it in no time.

By alphamone on Tuesday, January 29, 2008 - 09:21 pm:

saying rygar got me a majongkoro #32 (or whatever that colourpandora with the majong pattern is called)
